alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 21 at 2:54PM MDT until March 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches, with higher amounts possible above 9000 feet in the Sierra Madre Range. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches in the Snowy Range. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Outdoor recreation will be hazardous to those caught unprepared for winter conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
